jchess.common

Interface IBoard

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IBoardFactory
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBoardAgent, IBoardData
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoardAgent, BoardData

    public interface IBoard
extends IBoardFactory
    IBoard provides abstraction to IBoardData and IBoardAgent. It is mainly built for Cache module to make both the type compatible with its implementation (data population logic).
    Since:
    7 Dec 2019
    Author:
    Sajad Karim

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IPiece> getAllPieces()
      This method returns all the available IPiece objects.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IPlayer> getAllPlayers()
      This method returns all the available IPlayer objects.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IPosition> getAllPositions()
      This method returns all the available IPosition objects.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IRule> getAllRules()
      This method returns all the available IRule objects.
      IBoardData getBoardData()
      This method return the BoardData object.
      int getBoardHeight()
      Returns height of the Board.
      int getBoardWidth()
      Returns width of the Board.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns name of the Board.
      IPiece getPiece(java.lang.String stName)
      Returns IPiece against the value provided to it.
      IPlayer getPlayer(java.lang.String stName)
      Returns IPlayer against the value provided to it.
      IPosition getPosition(java.lang.String stName)
      Returns IPosition against the value provided to it.
      IRule getRule(java.lang.String stName)
      Returns IRule against the value provided to it.
      void init()
      This method is exposed to do Board internal initializations, and, gives control to IBoardData and IBoardAgent to perform their own custom initializations.

      • Methods inherited from interface jchess.common.IBoardFactory

        createPiece, createPlayer, createPosition, createRule
